parallel

Class RegisteredParcelPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.RegisteredParcelPool

  • final class RegisteredParcelPool
extends java.lang.Object
    The class is responsible for maintaining a sufficiently large array of RegisteredParcel objects, and there will be a pool for each thread of execution. In this way, there will be no need for invoking the new operator within the running threads requiring RegisteredParcel objects, unless a thread at some point runs out of space in its thread-local pool. This pool can only be safely used with the BlockingFasterMsgPassingCoordinator since the methods of this class do not "release" objects that were initially added in the shared queue from another thread's pool. Even though the other msg-passing coordinator classes have all their methods synchronized, the idiom cannot be safely used with them: one thread T1 could for example call on two different SimpleFasterMsgPassingCoordinators the sendData() method sequentially on each of them, and at the same time two other threads T2 and T3, could be calling in parallel the recvData() of each one coordinator respectively. In this case 2 RegisteredParcel objects belonging to T1's pool would be simultaneously and without any synchronization be calling the T1 pool's returnObjectToPool() method, corrupting at least the pool's _min/maxUsedPos data members. See the RegisteredParcelPoolFailTest for further details on how to show this phenomenon. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static RegisteredParcel getObject(int fromid, int toid, java.lang.Object data)
      factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one.
      (package private) RegisteredParcel getObjectFromPool()
      return an unmanaged "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
      (package private) void initialize()
      method is only called from RegisteredParcelThreadLocalPools right after this object is constructed to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.
      (package private) void returnObjectToPool(RegisteredParcel dlp)
      only called from RegisteredParcel.release() method.
      (package private) static void setIgnoreReleaseSanityTest(boolean val)
      must be called before any threads start using the RP-pools.
      (package private) static void setPoolSize(int num)
      sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        static RegisteredParcel getObject(int fromid,
                                  int toid,
                                  java.lang.Object data)
        factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one. The returned object, always has its data members (values) correctly set.
        Parameters:
        fromid - int
        toid - int
        data - Object
        Returns:
        RegisteredParcel

        method is only called from RegisteredParcelThreadLocalPools right after this object is constructed to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.

      • setPoolSize

        static void setPoolSize(int num)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified. Must only be called once, before any pool is actually constructed (should only be called from the RegisteredParcelThreadLocalPools class).
        Parameters:
        num - int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0
